questions.question: Where, in any specific case, different sections of this code specify different materials, methods of construction or other requirements, the most _________ shall govern.
The purpose of this code is to establish __________ requirements to safeguard the public safety, health and general welfare.
Where a referenced code or standard includes sugject matter that is within the scope of the IRC, the provisions of the _____ shall take precedence.
An alternative material or method shall be approved where the proposed design is ______ and complies with the ______ of the code.
Compliance with the specific _______-based provisions of the International Codes in Lieu of specific requirements of the IRC shall be permitted as an alternative.
A permit is not required for one-story detached accessory structures, provided that the floor area does not exceed ______ square feet.
Fences that are _____ feet or less in height do not require a permit.
A permit is not required for the replacement of branch circuit overcurrent devices (breakers) of the required capacity in the same location (within a panel).
Unattached decks not exceeding ______ square feed in area, that are not more than ________ inches above grade at any point, do not require a permit.
questions.note: provided the decks do not serve the exit door required by Section R311.4.

questions.question: Where equipment replacements and repairs must be performed in an emergency situation, the permit application shall be submitted within the _________ _______ business days.
An application for a permit for any proposed work shall be deemed to have been abandoned _______ days after the date of filing.
Before issuing a permit, the building official is ________ to examine or cause to be examined buildings, structures and sites for which an application has been filed.
Where the building official issues a permit, the construction documents shall be approced in writing or by a stamp which states _______ ________ ________ ________.
Final inspection shall be made after the permitted work is ___________ and prior to _______
If located in a flood hazard area, the documentation of elevations required in Section R322,.1.10 shall be submitted to the building offical prior to the ________ inspection.
Signifies access that requires the removal of an access panel or similar removable obstruction.
A finished or unfinished habitable space within an attic.
Hot water is water at a temperature greater than or equal to ________ degrees Fahrenheit.
A wall supporting a vertical load in addition to its own weight is a ________-________ wall.
What is the minimum uniformly distributed live load for habitable attics and attics served with fixed stairs?
Wood structural panels with a minimum thickness of _______ inch and a maximum span of _______ feet shall be permitted for opning protection in windborne debris regions.
The seismic provisions of the IRC apply to detached one- and two-family dwellings in Seismic Design Categories __________.

For dwellings with fire sprinkler systems, exterior walls with a fire seperation distance less than ________ feet shall have not less than a 1-hour fire-resistance rating with exposure from the outside.
In a nonspriklered townhouse building, the common wall between units shall be a minimum of _______ - hour _______ - __________ __________ wall assembly.

For townhouse separation, a parapet is not required where the roof sheathing is fire-retardant-treated wood for a distance of __________ feet on each side of the wall and there are no penetrations in the roof within _________ feet of the common wall.
Openings from a private garage directly into a room used for _______ ________ shall not be permitted.
Doors between the garage and residence shall be equipped with a _____ - ________ ________.
Garages shall be separated from residences and attics by not less than ________ - inch gypsum board or equivalent on the garage side.
Enclosed space under stairs that is accessed by a door or access panel shall have walls, under-stair surface and any soffits protected on the enclosed side with _______ - inch gypsum board.
Wall and ceiling finishes shall have a flame spread index of not greater than ___________.
In combustible construction, fireblocking shall be provided to cut off all concealed draft openings and to form an effective fire barrier between _________.
All habitable rooms shall be provided with aggregate glazing area of not less than ________ percent of the floor area of such rooms.
For natural ventilation for habitable rooms, the minimum openable area to the outdoors shall be ________ percent of the floor area being ventilated.
Bathrooms shall be provided with aggregate glazing area in windows of not less than _______ square feet, one-half of which must be openable.
Where the air infiltration rate of a dwelling unit is not more than _________ air changes per hour where tested, the dwelling unit shall be provided with _______ - ________ mechanical ventilation.
Dwelling units shall be provided with heating facilities capable of maintaining a minimum room temperature of ________ degrees Fahrenheit.
Habitable rooms shall have a floor area of not less than _______ square feet.
Habitable rooms shall be not less than _______ feet in any horizontal dimension.
Habitable space, hallways and portions of basements containing these spaces shall have a ceiling height of not less than _______ feet.
Bathrooms, toilet rooms and aluncdry rooms shall have a minimum ceiling height of _________ feet _______ inches
For rooms with sloped ceilings, at least ______ percent of the required floor area of the room must have a ceiling height of not less than 7 feet.
Portions of basements that do not contain habitable space or hallways shall have a ceiling height of not less than _________ feet ________ inches.
Every dwelling unit shall be provided with a water closet, lavatory, and a ______ or _______.
Each dwelling unit shall be provided with a kitchen area and every kitchen area shall be provided with a _________.
A clearance of at least ________ inches shall be provided at the front of a shower opening.
Showers and bathrubs with installed shower heads shall be finished with a nonabsorbent surface extending to a height of not less than _______ feet above the floor.
Glazing in all fixed and operable panels of swinging, sliding and bifold doors shall be considered a ________ _________.

A pane of glass in a window requires safety glazing if the pane is greater than _______ square feet with a bottom edge less than ________ inches above the floor and a top edge greater than ________ inches above the floor.
Glazing at the side of a stairway where the bottom exposed edge of glazing is less than ________ inches above the plane of the adjacent walking surface must be safety glazing.
Glazing less than _______ inches above the landing at the bottom of the stairway and within ______ inches of the bottom tread nosing must be safety glazing.
Garage floor surfaces shall be of approved _______ material.
Carports shall be open on at least _______ sides.
Basements, habitable attics and every sleeping room shall have at least one operable _______ _______ and ________ __________.
Where emergency escape and rescue openings are provided are provided, they shall have a sill height of not more than ______ inches above the floor.

All emergency escape and rescue openings shall have a minimum net clear opening of ______ square feet. Minimum net clear opening height shall be ______ inches. Minimum net clear opening width shall be ______ inches.

answer.question: The horizontal area of a window well serving an emergency escape and rescue opening shall be not less than ______ square feet.
Window wells serving emergency escape and rescue openings shall be designed for proper ________.
The required egress door for each dwelling unit shall be side-hinged, and shall provide a minimum clear width of ________ inches.
A landing at an exterior door shall have a minimum dimension of _______ inches measured in the direction of travel.
The landing on exterior side of the required egress door is permitted to be a maximum of ______ inches below the top of the threshold provided that the door does not swing over the landing.
The width of a hallway shall be not less than ______ feet.
Where a handrail is installed on one side, the clear width of stairways at handrail height shall be a minimum of ______ inches.
A flight of stairs shall not have a vertical rise larger than _______ inches between floor levels or landings.
There shall be a floor or _________ at the top and bottom of each stairway.
For stairs with a straight run, the landing shall have a minimum depth of ______ inches measured in the direction of travel.
Ramps shall have a maximum slope of _______ unit vertical in _______ units horizontal (8.3-percent slope). where serving the required egress door.
Stairways shall be not less than _______ inches in clear width at all points above the permitted handrail height and below the required headroom height.
Is plastic composite material permitted for use as exterior stair treads?
On stairways, the maximum riser height shall be _______ inches.
On stairways, the minimum tread depth shall be _______ inches.
On stairways, the greatest riser height within any flight of stairs shall not exceed the smallest by more than _______ inch.
On stairways, the greatest tread depth within any flgiht of stairs shall not exceed the smallest by more than _____ inches.
